text.section: To qualify for a license, a business entity or public unit shall meet the requirements of this section.

Each employee or agent of the business entity or public unit who will come in contact with asbestos or who will be responsible for removal or encapsulation of asbestos shall:
Be familiar with federal standards for asbestos removal and encapsulation; and
Have completed a course of instruction on asbestos removal and encapsulation approved by the Department.

The business entity or public unit shall demonstrate to the satisfaction of the Department that the business entity or public unit:
Is capable of complying with all applicable standards of the United States Environmental Protection Agency, the United States Occupational Safety and Health Administration, and the Commissioner of Labor and Industry acting under the Maryland Occupational Safety and Health Act; and
Has access to at least 1 approved asbestos disposal site for deposit of all asbestos waste that the business entity or public unit will generate during the term of the license.
The business entity or public unit shall meet any other standards that the Department sets.
